designScenario.name: Aircraft Hydraulic Valve System
designScenario.description: The Valve System regulates hydraulic fluid flow within the aircraft's hydraulic network to ensure precise actuation of flight control surfaces, landing gear, and braking systems. It operates under extreme pressure and temperature conditions while maintaining fail-safe redundancy and rapid response to pilot/autopilot commands.

details.description: The system shall direct hydraulic fluid to specified actuators with positional accuracy of ±1% to ensure synchronized control surface movements.
Valves shall maintain structural integrity at sustained pressures up to 5000 psi with peak tolerance of 6500 psi for 30-second durations.
Critical fluid paths shall implement parallel valve assemblies with automatic switchover capability upon primary system failure detection.
All electronic valve control components shall meet DO-160G Section 20 Category R EMI/EMC standards for aviation environments.

systemComponents.name: Primary Flow Control Module
systemComponents.description: Main control unit containing servo valves and pressure regulators for primary hydraulic circuit management.

subComponents.name: Proportional Servo Valve
subComponents.description: Precision metering valve with LVDT feedback for closed-loop flow control (±0.5% repeatability).

subComponents.name: Pressure Compensator
subComponents.description: Automatic pressure-balancing mechanism maintaining constant flow despite pump output variations.

systemComponents.name: Backup Hydraulic Gate
systemComponents.description: Passive pressure-actuated bypass valves that engage during electronic system failures.

subComponents.name: Shear Seal Cartridge
subComponents.description: Sacrificial mechanical fuse that isolates damaged hydraulic lines at 7000 psi overpressure.

systemComponents.name: Valve Control Electronics
systemComponents.description: ARINC 429-compliant controller implementing FBW (Fly-By-Wire) command processing with 3 redundant channels.

subComponents.name: Solenoid Driver Array
subComponents.description: Quad-redundant H-bridge circuits delivering 20A pulsed outputs for valve actuation.

relationships.description: Receives pressurized fluid input from engine-driven hydraulic pumps via high-pressure lines.
Direct mechanical linkage to aileron/spoiler actuators through dedicated fluid paths.
Embedded control logic governs servo valve positioning through PWM signals.

attributes.name: Hysteresis Tolerance
attributes.description: Maximum allowable hysteresis in valve positioning across full operational temperature range.

attributes.name: Fluid Contamination Level
attributes.description: Maximum particulate contamination level before requiring filter replacement.

attributes.name: Thermal Shock Rating
attributes.description: Certified temperature transition rate without performance degradation.

attributes.name: MTBF
attributes.description: Mean Time Between Failures calculated per MIL-HDBK-217F guidelines.

comments.body: Manages aircraft fluid flow systems including fuel and hydraulics
